types.name: Boolean
types.description: Represents `true` or `false` values.

types.name: String
types.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: QueryRoot
types.description: The schema's entry-point for queries. This acts as the public, top-level API from which all queries must start.

types.name: MoneyV2
types.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Decimal money amount.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: Currency of the money.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutStatus
types.description: The transfer status of the payout.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description:
The payout has been created and had transactions assigned to it, but
it has not yet been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: IN_TRANSIT
enumValues.description: The payout has been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: PAID
enumValues.description: The payout has been successfully deposited into the bank.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The payout has been declined by the bank.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The payout has been canceled by Shopify.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

fields.name: dateRange
fields.description: Specifies a time window that the contents of the card applies to.

fields.name: dismissMessage
fields.description: A message displayed when the user dismisses the card.

fields.name: dismissTitle
fields.description: A title displayed when the user dismisses the card.

fields.name: featured
fields.description: Specifies if this card should be considered to be featured inside of the feed theme header.

fields.name: feedbackOptions
fields.description: A list of predefined messages the user can select from when sending feedback about the card.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the card.

fields.name: image
fields.description: An image displayed on the card.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: contentType
args.description: Converts image file type from SVG to PNG, or leaves as original SVG.

fields.name: imageType
fields.description: Semantic type of a Home Card image. These can be used to treat images differently in the UI.

fields.name: layout
fields.description: Specifies a view template to use when rendering the card.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A more detailed description of the card, typically containing the actual messaging to the merchant.

fields.name: readTime
fields.description: Estimate of how long it takes to read the blog content.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: Reason why this card has been presented to the user.

fields.name: showVote
fields.description: Specifies if this card can be voted on.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Text for the header of the card.

types.name: BasicEvent
types.description:
Basic events chronicle resource activities such as the creation of an article, the fulfillment of an order, or
the addition of a product.

fields.name: appTitle
fields.description: The name of the app that created the event. Returns null when the event originates from the Shopify admin.

fields.name: attributeToApp
fields.description: Whether the event was created by an app.

fields.name: attributeToUser
fields.description: Whether the event was caused by an admin user.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time when the event was created.

fields.name: criticalAlert
fields.description: Whether the event is critical.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Human readable text that describes the event.

types.name: DiscountCodeApplication
types.description:
Discount code applications capture the intentions of a discount code at
the time that it is applied onto an order.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated to its entitled items.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The string identifying the discount code that was used at the time of application.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
An ordered index which can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: Which lines of targetType on the order that the discount is allocated over.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: The type of line on the order that the discount is applicable towards.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

types.name: ManualDiscountApplication
types.description: Manual discount applications capture the intentions of a discount that was manually created for an order.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated to its entitled items.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the application.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
An ordered index which can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: Which lines of targetType on the order that the discount is allocated over.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: The type of line on the order that the discount is applicable towards.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the application.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

types.name: ScriptDiscountApplication
types.description:
Script discount applications capture the intentions of a discount that
was created by a Shopify Script for an order's line item or shipping line.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated to its entitled items.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the application as defined by the Script.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
An ordered index which can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: Which lines of targetType on the order that the discount is allocated over.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: The type of line on the order that the discount is applicable towards.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
